net.canarymod.plugin

Interface PluginManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultPluginManager

    public interface PluginManager
    Main interface for the Canary Plugin Manager - responsible for enabling/disabling/loading plugins.
    Author:
    Pwootage

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void disableAllPlugins()
      Disables all plugins, used when shutting down the server.
      void disableAllPlugins(Logger log)
      Disables all plugins, used when shutting down the server.
      boolean disablePlugin(java.lang.String name)
      Disables the given plugin
      void enableEarlyPlugins()
      Enables all plugins that require to be loaded before sub systems and worlds.

      Enables all plugins, after loading worlds and subsystems.

      Enables the given plugin.

    • Method Detail

      • enablePlugin

        boolean enablePlugin(java.lang.String name)
              throws PluginLoadFailedException
        Enables the given plugin. Loads the plugin if not loaded (and available)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Plugin
        Returns:
        true on success, false on failure
        Throws:
        PluginLoadFailedException - If an error occurred when attempting to load the plugin.

      • enableLatePlugins

        void enableLatePlugins()
        Enables all plugins, after loading worlds and subsystems. Most plugins will be loaded here.

      • enableEarlyPlugins

        void enableEarlyPlugins()
        Enables all plugins that require to be loaded before sub systems and worlds. For instance, if they want to replace any of them.

      • disablePlugin

        boolean disablePlugin(java.lang.String name)
        Disables the given plugin
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Plugin
        Returns:
        true on success, false on failure

      • disableAllPlugins

        void disableAllPlugins()
        Disables all plugins, used when shutting down the server.

      • disableAllPlugins

        void disableAllPlugins(Logger log)
        Disables all plugins, used when shutting down the server.
        Parameters:
        log - The org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger to use when shutting down. This is necessary when in the shutdown hook, since we can't rely on external libraries there (see the javadoc at Runtime.addShutdownHook(Thread))

      • reloadPlugin

        boolean reloadPlugin(java.lang.String name)
              throws PluginLoadFailedException,
                     InvalidPluginException
        Reload the specified plugin
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        true on success, false on failure which probably means the plugin is now not enabled nor loaded
        Throws:
        PluginLoadFailedException
        InvalidPluginException

      • getPlugin

        Plugin getPlugin(java.lang.String name)
        Get the Plugin with specified name.
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        The plugin for the given name, or null on failure.

      • getPlugins

        java.util.Collection<Plugin> getPlugins()
        Gets an unmodifiable collection of currently loaded Plugins
        Returns:
        unmodifiable collection of Plugins

      • getPluginDescriptors

        java.util.Collection<PluginDescriptor> getPluginDescriptors()
        Gets an unmodifiable collection of currently known PluginDescriptions
        Returns:
        unmodifiable collection of PluginDescriptions

      • getPluginDescriptor

        PluginDescriptor getPluginDescriptor(Plugin plugin)
        Gets the plugin descriptor for a plugin.
        Parameters:
        plugin - Plugin to get descriptor for
        Returns:
        Descriptor for plugin

      • getPluginDescriptor

        PluginDescriptor getPluginDescriptor(java.lang.String plugin)
        Gets the plugin descriptor for a plugin by name, loading it if not loaded.
        Parameters:
        plugin - Plugin to get descriptor for
        Returns:
        Descriptor for plugin

      • scanForPlugins

        void scanForPlugins()
        Scans the plugin folder for any new plugins. Will ignore any already-known plugins.

      • getPluginNames

        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getPluginNames()
        Gets a list of all currently known plugin names
        Returns:
        List of known plugin names
